212490-d-07-29-09-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Other general switching rules (Provide detailed  description in narrative)
212490-d-07-29-09-SOO.Accident Cause: Other general switching rules (Provide detailed  description in narrative)
212490-d-07-29-09-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT GH-31 (WITH CP 6059 - FACING WEST) RECEIVED PERMISSION FROM IOC ON CHANNEL 65-65 AT TO USE PB3 FOR HEAD ROOM, THEY LINED IT UP FOR THEIR MOVEMENT AND BEGAN WORKING ON CHANNEL 84-84. THEY SPOTTED 2 EAST CARS ON A-RIP, THEN WENT INTO THE RUN-A-ROUND TRACK FOR A BLOCK OF 9 CARS.  ASSIGNMENT241-27 CONTACTED THE IOC ON CHANNEL 65-65 FOR A TRACK TO SHOVE 13 INTERMODAL CARS INTO.  241-27 WASINSTRUCTED TO SHOVE INTO PB5 AND TO LOOK OUT FOR ASSIGNMENT GH-31, AS THEY WERE OUT THERE TAKING HEAD ROOM. 241 STATED THAT THEY LINED UP THEIR ROUTE FOR PB5 AND DIDNT SEE ASSIGNMENT GH-31 ANYWHERE, BUT THE CONDUCTOR THOUGHT THAT THEY MIGHT HAVE BEEN DOWN IN THE LEGS OF RIP, WHICH ARE APPROXIMATELY1000-1500 FEET FROM WHERE THE ENTRANCE TO INTERMODAL LEAD IS LOCATED. BOTH ASSIGNMENTS HAVE TO OCCUPY THIS LEAD TO GET TO EITHER PB3 OR PB5. 241 GOT THEIR LINEUP FOR PB5 AND STARTED SHOVING. 241S CONDUCTOR WAS ON THE NORTH SIDE OF HIS SHOVE AND STATES HE DIDNT SEE OR HEAR ANYTHING. 241S ENGINEER STOPPED THE MOVEMENT AFTER HE FELT SOME RESISTANCE WITH HIS SHOVE - BY THAT TIME HE HAD SHOVED 12 AND 1/2 CARS PAST THE CP 6059 (GH31S ENGINE) WHICH HAD COME DOWN ON TOP OF 241S SHOVE. INSPECTION REVEALED THE SOUTH SIDE OF 241S TRAIN HAD BEEN SIDE SWIPED AND, ASSIGNMENT GH-31 LOCOMOTIVE CP6059 WAS DERAILED, LEANING SOUTHWARD AND SPILLED APPROXIMATELY 40 GALLONS OF FUEL. MECHANICAL DEPT. NOTIFIED ANDABSORBENT PADS USED TO CLEAN UP FUEL.

M-O-W EIC DROPPED DERAILED AND RED FLAGS TO ALLOW TRAIN TO PASS THROUGH LIMITS AFTERHE CLEARED TAMPER AND REGULATOR. TRAIN PASSED THROUGH LIMITS PROCEEDING WEST. AFTER TRAIN PASSED MP48.9 EIC RE-INSTALLED DERAIL AND RED FLAGS SO TAMPER CREW COULD GET BACK TO WORK. TRAIN PROCEEDED WEST APPROXIMATELY ANOTHER MILE AND AGAIN STOPPED FOR ANOTHER M-O-W GANG CLEANING DITCHES. TRAIN WASSTOPPED FOR APPROXIMATELY 10 MINUTES BEING HELD UP FOR A MINOR MECHANICAL ISSUE WITH THE ROTARY DUMP. CREW DECIDED TO SHOVE BACK AND CLEAR CROSSING. CREW DISCUSSED THEY THOUGHT THEY HAD ENOUGH ROOM TOSHOVE BACK AND THEN THEY MADE A BLIND SHOVE ON THE MAIN TRACK, WITHOUT CODUCTOR PROTECTING THE SHOVE TO SHOVE BACK TO CLEAR CROSSING. TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY BEFORE HEAD END CLEARED CROSSING. CONDUCTOR WALED BACK AND FOUND THE REAR FOUR CARS IN TRAIN HAD BEEN SHOVED OVER THE DERAIL AND RED FLAG.

0901-d-07-14-09-HRRC.Narrative: TRAIN NX- 13 WAS OPERATING NORTHBOUND ON MAIN TRACK UNDER NORAC/DCS AUTHORITY FORM CONTROL SYSTEM RULES.  THE 13TH AND 14TH CARS OF THE CONSIST DERAILED BUT DID NOT RESULT IN ANY INJURIES OR RELEASE OF HAZMAT MATERIAL.  THE PRIMARY CAUSE IS A SHIFTED LOAD OF CONSTRUCTION AND DEMOLITION DEBRIS.  IT CAUSED WHEEL R.1 OF GACX 952 TO RIDE UP AND OVER HIGH RAIL IN A COMPOUND CURVE PUMPING RAIL JOINTS ONTHE LOW RAIL.  THAT IS SHOWN AS THE CONTRIBUTING CAUSE.  DAMAGE COST SHOWN ARE ESTIMATES

D552209-d-07-04-09-KO.Narrative: CREW HAD BEEN WORKING TO BUILD THEIR TRAIN ON THE END OF YAGGY. AS THEY PREPARED TO MAKE THEIR FINALMOVE BEFORE DEPARTING THEY WERE SETTING TRAFFIC OVER INTO TRACK 403. CONDUCTOR WAS RIDING THE POINTTO A HOOK IN TRACK 403 AND HAD AHOLD OF 16 LOADED HOPPERS. AS THEY GOT CLOSER TO THE JOINT THE MOVEMENT ROLLED TO A STOP. CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK 5 CAR LENGTHS AND FOUND THAT THE SWITCH POINT BROKE ONTHE SWITCH FROM THE MAINLINE INTO THE YARD. THE BREAK ON THE SWITCH POINT WAS FRESH AND WAS UNDER LOAD WHEN IT BROKE.  THIS ALLOWED THE WHEEL TO CLIMB THE RAIL AT WHICH POINT IT RODE THE RAIL UNIT ITREACHED THE FROG LEADING INTO TRACK 401. THE TRUCK OF THAT CAR THEN HEADED DOWN TRACK 401 PULLING THE NEXT CAR WITH IT UNIT IT DUG IN AND THE MOVEMENT STOPPED.

073009105-d-07-30-09-TSRR.Narrative:
ON JULY 30, 2009, TSRR 105 DEPARTED THE COLUMBIA DEPOT SOUTHBOUND FOR PULASKI ON THE N&D.  ONE ENGINEER AND ONE BRAKEMAN WERE ON ENGINE 1959 WITH A CONSIST OF TWO CARS.  THE CARS WERE CSXT 486183 EMPTY GONDOLA (NEXT TO LOCOMOTIVE) AND PLCX 
224730 LOADED TANK WITH POLYPROPYLENE GLYCOL (STCC 28-185-55), A NON-HAZARDOUS, NON-DANGEROUS LIQUID PLASTIC.  THE TRAIN 
DEPARTED COLUMBIA DEPOT AT 12:05 PM.  AT MILEPOST 235.3, THE TWO CARS DERAILED AND TURNED OVER GOING DOWN THE EAST SIDE OF THE TRACK.THIS OCCURRED AT APPROXIMATELY 12:30 PM.  THERE WAS NO BREACH TO THE TANK CAR.  THE GONDOLA AND TANKSTAYED COUPLED TOGETHER DUE TO THE DOUBLE SHELF COUPLER OF THE TANK.  THE ENGINEER CALLED AND REPORTED THE INCIDENT TO THE MT. PLEASANT DEPOT.  THE GENERAL MANAGER, SAFETY MANAGER, AND ROADMASTER ARRIVED ON SCENE.  THROUGH THEIR DISCUSSION AND OBSERVATIONS, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE TANK CAR KICKED A JOINT BAR OUT ON THE WEST SIDE, THE TRACK SPREAD CAUSING THE LEAD SET OF TRUCKS ON THE TANK CARTO DERAIL TO THE EAST SIDE.  IT PULLED THE GONDOLA WITH IT TO A SOFT SHOULDER OF THE BANK AND ROLLEDDOWN THE BANK. BOTH CARS STILL COUPLED, CAME TO REST AT THE BOTTOM OF THE BANK, APPROXIMATELY 10-12FEET BELOW THE TOP OF THE RAIL.  EVIDENCE (WHEEL MARKS ON TOP OF RAIL CROSSTIES) SHOW THAT THE CARCAME OFF THE TRACK AND TURNED OVER ALL WITHIN A 20 FOOT DISTANCE.  AFTER DISCUSSION WITH THE TRAIN CREW, THEIR STATEMENT CONCUR WITH THE EVIDENCE FOUND AT THE DERAILMENT SIGHT. DURING THESE DISCUSSION

PR0709102-d-07-07-09-BNSF.Narrative: Y-GUE2011-07A WAS TAKING E-AMHATM0-15A LIGHT POWER TO PIT. CREW LINED TWO UNITS INTO NORTH PIT, FIRST LOCO AND FIRST TRUCK OF SECOND LOCO (BNSF 5603) MADE IT OVER THE SWITCH.  SECOND TRUCK OF BNSF 5603 WENT DOWN THE READY 2 TRACK, CAUSING BNSF 5603 TO DERAIL.  CREW REPORTED ERRATIC ACTIVITY OF THE SWITCH DURING THE DERAILMENT, GOING BACK AND FORTH ON ITS OWN.

0709LK031-d-07-19-09-UP.Narrative: YNL34R-18 HAD PULLED 26 BAD ORDER CARS OUT OF TRACK 54 AND WERE IN THE PROCESS OF SHOVING THE SAME CARS INTO TRACK 212 WHEN THREE CARS FROM THE NORTH END OF THE CUT DERAILED IN THE TIGHT TURNOUT AT THE NORTH END OF THE 50 LEAD. 0709LV002-d-07-03-09-UP.Narrative: UP'S KLBNO-29 WAS PULLING IN TRACK RD2 AT GENTILLY.  ENGINEER NOTICED TRAIN STARTED TO PICK UP SPEEDSO HE SET MINIMUM AIR UNDER TRAIN, THEN HE FELT THE TRAIN SIT DOWN.  THE THEN TRIED TO PULL THE CARS UP TO NOTCH #3 AND THEY WOULDN'T PULL.  AFTER THAT THE CONDUCTOR WENT TO CHECK THE TRAIN OUT WITHHIS LIMO THAT WAS WAITING FOR THE CREW.  THAT IS WHEN HE DISCOVERED THAT THEIR TRAIN HAD DERAILED 2(5-PACKER) CARS.  CONDUCTOR THEN NOTIFIED CSQZ YARDMASTER.  CSQZ MAINTAINS TRACK.

112982-d-07-06-09-ATK.Narrative: MARC TRAIN 9503 WITH CAB CAR 87852 LEADING 8 CARS AND LOCOMOTIVE 4913 PUSHING LOST POWER. TRAIN DRIFTED TO STOP AT MP 93, CENTER SECTION OF CARBON MISSING DUE TO UNKNOWN REASON ALLOWING TROLLEY WIRE TO RIDE ON METAL PORTION OF CARRIERASSEMBLY. WIRE RODE ON METAL PORTION TILL THE POINT IT CUT THROUGHALLOWING LEADING PORTION OF CARRIER TO RISE ABOVE THE RIDING PLANE OF THE WIRE STRIKING A Y HANGER.THE AIR LINE WAS SEVERED WHICH ENABLED BROKEN PANTOGRAPH ALARM AND LOWERED PANTOGRAPH. THE CAUSE WAS A MISSING CENTER CARBON ON THE END OF PANTOGRAPH OF LOCOMOTIVE 4913.

639192-d-07-11-09-EJE.Narrative: L51491-11 WAS SWITCHING CARS AT POLY ENTEC WHEN THE CREW DOUBLED TRACK #2 TO CAR ON THE LEAD AND INTENDED TO SHOVE ALL THE CARS INTO TRACK #2 WHICH WAS CLEAR FOR SPOT.  THE BRAKEMAN LINED THE #3 SWITCH INSTEAD OF THE #2 CAUSING THE CARS TO GO INTO TRACK #3 WHICH HAD 9 LOADED CARS.  THE RESULT WAS THE NORTH CAR, CEFX 51345, WENT THRU THE BUMPING POST AND ONTO THE ROAD DERAILING. THE CAUSE HAS BEENDETERMINED TO BE AN IMPROPERLY LINED SWITCH.  THE CREW WAS TESTED FOR CAUSE AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.
